IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE AGENCY PROVIDES A RESIDENTIAL SETTING TO ASSIST ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES TO ACCOMPLISH AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST ATTAINABLE LIVING SKILLS AND TO IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE BY SUPPORTING INDEPENDENCE.THE AGENCY OWNS AND OPERATES FIVE GROUP HOMES IN PORTLAND AND WESTBROOK, MAINE. THE AGENCY ALSO RENTS HOUSES AND APARTMENTS IN THE GREATER PORTLAND, MAINE AREA TO PROVIDE SUPPORTED LIVING PROGRAMS FOR ITS CONSUMERS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE AGENCY PROVIDES A RESIDENTIAL SETTING TO ASSIST ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES TO ACCOMPLISH AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST ATTAINABLE LIVING SKILLS AND TO IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE BY SUPPORTING INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES AND SERVICES FOR ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM PARTICIPATED IN THE GIFTS IN KIND INTERNATIONAL PROGRAM AND RECEIVED CONTRIBUTIONS OF GOODS FROM WILLIAMS SONOMA, INC. THE ITEMS RECEIVED WERE HOUSEHOLD GOODS TO BE USED IN THE HOMES; THEY INCLUDED A MIXTURE OF FIRST RUN MERCHANDISE, OVERSTOCK, CLOSEOUT, DAMAGED, AND UNCLAIMED CUSTOM GOODS. WILLIAMS SONOMA, INC. REPORTED ITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE AGENCY AT FULL RETAIL VALUE, WHICH DOES NOT REPRESENT FAIR MARKET VALUE. THE AGENCY DID NOT REPORT ANY CONTRIBUTIONS REVENUES FOR THESE ITEMS DUE TO THE DIFFICULTY IN DETERMINING FAIR MARKET VALUE.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM DOES NOT EXPEND FUNDS FOR DIRECT OR GRASSROOTS LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. GROUP MAIN STREAM PARTICIPATES IN THE MAINE ASSOCIATION FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE PROVIDERS ("MEACSP"), A TRADE ASSOCIATION WHOSE MEMBERS ARE MAINE ORGANIZATIONS WHICH PROVIDE SUPPORT AND SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL AND OTHER COGNITIVE DISABILITIES. THE MAINE ASSOCIATION FOR COMMUNITY SERVICE PROVIDERS IS ITSELF A NON-PROFIT AGENCY WHOSE MISSION IS TO REPRESENT INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS WHO SUPPORT PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE, LEARN AND WORK IN THE COMMUNITY OF THEIR CHOICE THROUGH LEGISLATIVE ACTION, ORGANIZATIONAL ADVOCACY, TRAINING AND PUBLIC EDUCATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS ASSIST THE ACCOUNTING FIRM WITH PREPARATION OF THE ANNUAL FORM 990. THEY REVIEW A DRAFT OF FORM 990 FOR COMPLETENESS AND ACCURACY. THEY ALSO REVIEW NARRATIVES DESCRIBING THE AGENCY'S MISSION, PROGRAMS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE UP TO DATE AND ACCURATE. THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND TREASURER THEN REVIEW THE DRAFT OF FORM 990, MEETING WITH MANAGEMENT AND THE ACCOUNTING FIRM AS CONSIDERED NECESSARY TO RESOLVE ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS. WHEN THEIR REVIEW IS COMPLETE, A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO ALL DIRECTORS, WHO ARE GIVEN TIME FOR QUESTIONS AND FEEDBACK. THE BOARD PRESIDENT, TREASURER, MANAGEMENT AND THE ACCOUNTING FIRM INCORPORATE THIS FEEDBACK INTO THE FINAL 990, WHICH IS THEN FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT USE A FORMAL "ANNUAL DISCLOSURE" PROCESS TO MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. DIRECTORS, MANAGEMENT, AND STAFF ARE EXPECTED TO VOLUNTARILY DISCLOSE ANY ACTIVITIES OR RELATIONSHIPS THAT VIOLATE OR COULD POTENTIALLY VIOLATE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AS SOON AS THOSE SITUATIONS ARISE. EACH INDIVIDUAL SITUATION IS ASSESSED AND RESOLUTION DETERMINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM USES THE MAINE ASSOCIATION FOR NON-PROFITS COMPENSATION HANDBOOK, PUBLISHED BI-ANNUALLY, AS A GUIDELINE FOR ESTABLISHING SALARY LEVELS FOR ALL POSITIONS. ALSO, THE AGENCY PERFORMS INFORMAL INQUIRIES OF SIMILAR AGENCIES IN THE COMMUNITY REGARDING COMPENSATION RATES FOR DIRECT SERVICE PROVIDER POSITIONS, WHICH ARE TYPICALLY THE MOST DIFFICULT TO FILL. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ESTABLISHES THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION ANNUALLY AND APPROVES THE TOTAL AGENCY SALARIES AND BENEFITS DURING THE ANNUAL BUDGET REVIEW. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND MANAGEMENT TEAM, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE, ARE CHARGED WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE SPECIFIC POSITIONS WITHIN THE AGENCY, THE JOB DESCRIPTIONS, AND THE APPROPRIATE SALARY RANGE FOR EACH. THESE ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS NECESSARY AS WELL AS IN CONJUNCTION WITH BUDGET PREPARATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM MAKES AVAILABLE, UPON WRITTEN REQUEST, ITS FORM 990 AND ALL OTHER INFORMATION AND DOCUMENTS REQUIRED BY LAW TO BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION. THE AGENCY HAS A WEBSITE BUT DOES NOT POST THESE DOCUMENTS ON IT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM MAKES AVAILABLE, UPON WRITTEN REQUEST, ITS FORM 990 AND ALL OTHER INFORMATION AND DOCUMENTS REQUIRED BY LAW TO BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION. THE AGENCY HAS A WEBSITE BUT DOES NOT POST THESE DOCUMENTS ON IT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: OVERSIGHT OF COMPILATION AND SELECTION OF ACCOUNTING FIRM
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SELECTS THE ACCOUNTING FIRM WHICH COMPILES THE AGENCY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE AGECNY'S ACCOUNTING FIRM IS NOT INDEPENDENT BECAUSE THE TREASURER OF THE AGENCY'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS AN EMPLOYEE OF THE FIRM; THIS FACT IS DISCLOSED ANNUALLY IN THE COMPILATION REPORT. THE TREASURER WAS A BOARD MEMBER PRIOR TO JOINING THE ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND FINANCE MANAGER ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE COMPILATION ENGAGEMENT. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ALSO REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPILED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AT A REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETING. THERE ARE NO CHANGES FROM PROCEDURES IN PREVIOUS YEARS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CONFLICT OF INTEREST, WHISTLEBLOWER, AND DOCUMENTS RETENTION POLICIES
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Page 6, Part VI, Section B, Lines 12(a), 12(b), 12(c), 13, 14
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GROUP MAIN STREAM HAS FORMAL WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CONFIDENTIALITY, AND WHISTLEBLOWER POLICIES IN ITS PERSONNEL POLICIES. THESE ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY WITH STAFF. THE AGENCY ALSO HAS WRITTEN DOCUMENTS STORAGE AND DESTRUCTION POLICIES, WHICH FOLLOW THE DESTRUCTION POLICY PROMULGATED BY THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES. LOGS OF RECORDS STORED OFFSITE ARE MAINTAINED BY THE AGENCY. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS ADOPTED A FORMAL, WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH REQUIRES DIRECTORS TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AS SOON AS THEY ARISE. THE POLICY CHARGES THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WITH TAKING APPROPRIATE ACTION WHEN A CONFLICT IS IDENTIFIED. THE BOARD ALSO HAS FORMAL WRITTEN CONFIDENTIALITY AND WHISTLEBLOWER POLICIES SPECIFIC TO DIRECTORS. THE AGENCY BYLAWS SPECIFICALLY PROHIBIT ANY FORM OF COMPENSATION TO DIRECTORS.
